title: What are the forces marked in a free body diagram? - Quora

response.answer_text: While drawing a free body diagram we remove all the connections the body has. All those connections are replaced by the forces exerted by them, on the body, whose Free Body Diagram is being drawn. Two examples are shown in the figures below. (1) Block placed on a plane. Free Body Diagram of the block shown. The plane is replaced by the force [math]\  F_{12}.[/math]  (2) Figure 2 shows a Belt Drive. Free Body Diagrams for both the Pulleys shown in the figure below. Note the load and Motor are replaced by the torques on the pulleys.
